title: Andhra Pradesh's Araku Coffee earns organic certification, secures buyers from Europe, Tata group
desc: GCC has achieved organic certification for Araku coffee, facilitating entry into European markets and collaboration with Tata Consumer Products for marketing and sales. The certification process, ongoing since 2019, now involves 2,600 tribal farmers, ensuring increased and fair pricing for their organic produce.

title: Andhra Govt unveils Rs 3.22 lakh crore budget with focus on farmers, students, fishermen
desc: The Andhra Pradesh government, led by N Chandrababu Naidu, presented a ₹3.22 lakh crore budget focusing on school education and key electoral promises. The budget includes ₹20,000 annual aid per farmer, ₹15,000 yearly for school children under the 'Talliki Vandanam' scheme, and free electricity to schools. It also allocates significant funds to health, rural development, and irrigation projects.

title: Govt says achieved goal of setting up of 10,000 farmer producer organisations
desc: The government announced the achievement of establishing 10,000 farmer producer organisations (FPOs) under a central scheme, aimed at boosting agricultural productivity and income. This milestone involves significant financial and handholding support, positively impacting millions of farmers, including a substantial proportion of women.

title: Farmers' protest: Supreme Court to hear matter after March 19
desc: The Supreme Court deferred the hearing on the farmers' protest to March 19, recognizing ongoing dialogue between the Centre and farmers. The court noted the high-powered committee's efforts and awaited further negotiations. The Punjab government's involvement and aid to hunger-striking farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal were also acknowledged.

title: Another round of unity talks among farmer bodies remains inconclusive
desc: The unity talks between farmer bodies SKM, SKM (Non-political), and KMM remain inconclusive after four rounds, as significant differences persist. Despite detailed discussions and a focus on common programmes, complete unity is unattainable. Efforts continue to reconcile demands, including the legal guarantee of MSP for crops.

title: Ridiculous to say farmers' stubble burning causing Delhi pollution: Piyush Goyal
desc: Union Minister Piyush Goyal called it "ridiculous" to blame Punjab farmers for Delhi's pollution. He emphasized that the main causes are construction activities and vehicle emissions. Speaking at an industry event, Goyal advocated for precast construction and electric mobility to address urban pollution. He encouraged a collective effort to adopt cleaner practices rather than shifting blame.

title: Not received PM Kisan 19th instalment? Get this money in your bank account after doing e-KYC
desc: Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced the 19th instalment of the PM Kisan Yojana. The PM-Kisan scheme provides Rs 6,000 annually in three installments. Farmers can now complete e-KYC via OTP, biometric, or face authentication methods. The process ensures transparency and prevents misuse.

title: Operative Kisan Credit Card amount crosses Rs 10 lakh crore benefiting 7.72 crore farmers
desc: The finance ministry announced that the Kisan Credit Card (KCC) scheme has provided over Rs 10 lakh crore in affordable loans to 7.72 crore farmers as of December 31, 2024, up from Rs 4.26 lakh crore in 2014. The government also offers interest subventions and plans to increase the loan limit to further benefit farmers.

title: PM Modi hails Bihar CM Nitish Kumar as 'ladla' CM in NDA unity display
desc: During Narendra Modi's visit to Bhagalpur, Bihar, he and CM Nitish Kumar showcased the NDA's unity, with Modi praising Kumar as Bihar's 'Ladla' Chief Minister. Modi released ₹22,000 crore under the PM Kisan scheme, benefiting over 75 lakh farmers in Bihar. Modi targeted the opposition, highlighted farmer welfare schemes, and announced development projects in Bihar.

title: PM Modi targets Lalu Yadav, says those who 'ate fodder meant for animals' cannot think about farmers' welfare
desc: Prime Minister Narendra Modi criticized RJD leader Lalu Prasad for his involvement in the fodder scam, emphasizing that such individuals cannot prioritize farmers' welfare. He highlighted the NDA government's efforts in supporting farmers, including the direct transfer of funds through the PM-KISAN scheme. Modi also noted the boost in agricultural exports and announced the upcoming establishment of a Makhana board.

title: Bihar's people will never forgive leaders of 'Jungle Raj' who mocked Maha Kumbh: PM Modi
desc: Prime Minister Narendra Modi criticized RJD supremo Lalu Prasad for mocking the Maha Kumbh Mela, stating that Bihar's people will not forgive those who disrespect Hindu religion. Speaking at a rally, Modi asserted the NDA government's commitment to farmers, announced infrastructural investments, and highlighted increased milk production and new makhana board efforts for Bihar's progress.

title: BJP preparing to use PM's Bihar visit to kickstart poll campaign
desc: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to visit Bihar's Bhagalpur district to participate in a farmers' programme. He will release the 19th instalment of PM KISAN, providing over ₹21,500 crore in direct benefits to more than 9.7 crore farmers nationwide. Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan engaged with makhana farmers prior to the visit.

title: From surplus to struggle: Financial woes of Telangana mount ahead of session
desc: Telangana faces a significant revenue shortfall, with a deficit of ₹26,050 crore by January. The state's financial strain is expected to worsen with the introduction of three major welfare schemes, including aid for farmers, landless agricultural labourers, and the homeless. Despite exceeding its planned borrowings, the government is under pressure to balance commitments and present a realistic budget in March.

title: Talks with farmers held in cordial atmosphere; next meeting in Chandigarh on March 19: Shivraj Chouhan
desc: Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan described the meeting with farmer leaders as cordial, with discussions centered on farmers' welfare programs. The talks addressed various demands, including a legal guarantee for MSP on crops. The next meeting will be held on March 19 in Chandigarh.

title: Govt working out scheme to prevent distress sale of farmers' produce: Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh
desc: Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan highlighted measures to prevent farmers from selling produce at low prices, emphasizing the importance of transferring new seed varieties and technologies to fields quickly. The Pusa Krishi Vigyan Mela 2025 aims to showcase advancements and support farmers with live demonstrations and agro-advisories.

title: India likely to raise vegetable oil import taxes to help support local farmers
desc: India is set to raise import taxes on vegetable oils again within six months to assist oilseed farmers affected by plummeting domestic prices. This move may increase local oil prices, reduce demand, and lower imports of palm, soyoil, and sunflower oil.

title: Govt policies have forced educated youths to work as delivery agents: Akhilesh in LS
desc: Akhilesh Yadav criticizes the Indian government's failures, citing farmer agitations and youth unemployment. He argues that GST and demonetisation have hindered economic growth and demands job opportunities based on skills. Additionally, he questions UP's handling of the Maha Kumbh festival and criticizes the targeted budget for benefiting the wealthy while neglecting the common man.

title: Govt says 2.05 cr farmer IDs created under Digital Agriculture Mission
desc: Over 2.05 crore farmer IDs have been generated under India's Digital Agriculture Mission, covering various states including Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, Gujarat, and Maharashtra. The initiative aims to develop a comprehensive digital agriculture ecosystem, providing innovative solutions and reliable crop data to farmers across the country.

title: Pakistan: Balochistan farmers reject 35 pc tax on agricultural production, call it "cruel", "anti-farmer"
desc: The Green Kissan Ittehad (GKI) vehemently opposed the 35% tax on agricultural production in Balochistan and Pakistan, calling it 'cruel' and 'anti-farmer'. GKI President Agha Lal Jan Ahmadzai criticized the government's poor support for the agriculture sector and its adverse impact on farmers' livelihoods and agricultural sustainability.

title: No corruption in foodgrain procurement: Pralhad Joshi junks opposition charges
desc: Minister Pralhad Joshi asserted that there is no corruption in the foodgrain procurement process and that payments to farmers are made directly into their bank accounts. He emphasized that under the Modi government, 100% of funds reach the farmers, contrasting this with the UPA tenure.

title: Controversy over comments on Prez Murmu: Rashtrapati Bhavan says Sonia Gandhi's remarks in 'poor taste'
desc: Rashtrapati Bhavan has criticized Congress leader Sonia Gandhi's remarks about President Droupadi Murmu, labeling them as 'in poor taste.' The statement emphasized that the President was not tired during her speech and highlighted her commitment to advocating for marginalized communities, women, and farmers.

title: Priyank Kharge slams Centre's 'Modinomics', says Union Budget unlikely to bring relief
desc: Karnataka Minister Priyank Kharge criticizes the Centre's economic policies, dubbing them 'Modinomics,' and blames them for unemployment and failing initiatives. He also accuses the government of neglecting Karnataka's interests. The Union Budget 2025 is to be presented by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman today.

title: UP govt's claim on economy unrealistic, BJP can only say a trillion lies: Akhilesh Yadav
desc: Akhilesh Yadav criticizes the Uttar Pradesh government's claim of achieving a USD 1 trillion economy in four years, calling it an impossible 'big lie' due to rampant corruption, lack of investments, and rising unemployment. He expresses concern over inflation, income levels, job creation, and escalating costs, asserting that people do not want the BJP.

title: 121 farmers end fast-unto-death after Dallewal take medical aid
desc: After taking medical aid, farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal ended his fast-unto-death, along with 121 farmers, following the Centre's invitation for talks on February 14. Deteriorating health and government inaction had led 111 farmers to join Dallewal on January 15, with 10 more joining later. Talks will address a legal guarantee for minimum support prices for crops.

title: Some proposals received from Centre, will discuss it, say agitating farmers
desc: Farmers at the Punjab-Haryana borders have received a proposal from the central government amidst their ongoing protests for a legal guarantee of MSP for crops. Farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal has been on an indefinite hunger strike since November 26, and additional farmers have joined the fast. The proposal is currently under discussion by the farmers' leaders.

title: Congress to embark on 'Kisan Mazdoor Samman Evam Nyay Yatra' in UP from February
desc: The Congress has postponed its 'Kisan Mazdoor Samman Evam Nyay Yatra' in Uttar Pradesh to avoid clashing with the Maha Kumbh, planning to start next month. The yatra aims to address the grievances of farmers, including payment issues and lack of compensation for land acquisition, with statewide involvement of 300 'Kisan Nyay Yoddhas' in each district.

title: Karnataka: Kumaraswamy questions Govt over delay in compensating NICE land losers
desc: Union Minister HD Kumaraswamy criticized the Karnataka government for delaying compensation to farmers whose lands were acquired for the BMIC project despite Supreme Court orders. He accused officials and Congress leaders of colluding to exploit farmers and urged the government to take immediate action.

title: Fitting reply to Opposition: Telangana Minister Jupally Krishna Rao after govt increases Rythu Bharosa cash handout
desc: Telangana Minister Jupally Krishna Rao announces increased benefits for farmers under the Rythu Bharosa scheme, providing Rs 12,000 per acre annually. Additionally, landless families and agricultural laborers will receive similar benefits under the Indiramma Atmeeya Bharosa scheme. These initiatives aim to counter opposition criticism and support farmers starting January 26, 2025.

title: Farmers' Protests: Jagjit Singh Dallewal to take medical aid if Centre agrees to talk, Punjab tells SC
desc: The Punjab government sought additional time from the Supreme Court to comply with orders for hospitalizing farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal, on a fast for over a month. Dallewal has agreed to accept medical aid if the Centre agrees to hold talks. The court granted the request, scheduling a compliance review for January 2, 2025.
